ðŸ”¥ persepolis | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and accelerating file downloads from the internet.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-segment downloading (64 connections) â€¢ Scheduling downloads â€¢ Download queuing â€¢ Downloading videos from Youtube and ...
ðŸ“– Summary: Persepolis Download Manager is a free and open-source download manager written in Python, supporting multi-segment downloads, scheduling, and queuing. It is available for GNU/Linux, BSDs, macOS, and Windows, and can download videos from platforms like YouTube.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ auto-py-to-exe | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Converting Python scripts into executable files for easy distribution.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ GUI for converting .py to .exe â€¢ Uses PyInstaller â€¢ Supports Python 3.6-3.12 â€¢ Installable via PyPI or GitHub â€¢ Cross-platform (Windows, Linux, macOS)
ðŸ“– Summary: Auto PY to EXE is a tool that converts Python scripts (.py) into executable files (.exe) using a graphical user interface. It leverages PyInstaller to bundle the script and its dependencies into a single executable, making it easier to distribute Python applications to users who may not have Python installed.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ Notemod | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Personal note-taking and task management with data synchronization and offline access.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Easy Note-Taking â€¢ Creating Tasks â€¢ Rich Text Editor â€¢ Synchronization â€¢ Save All Your Data
ðŸ“– Summary: Notemod is a free and open-source note-taking application designed for simplicity and accessibility. It offers features like easy note-taking, rich text editing, task creation, data synchronization via GitHub Gist, local data storage with export/import options, and offline access, catering to students, professionals, and creative thinkers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ascii-flix | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Watching videos in the terminal as ASCII art.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Convert video frames into ASCII art â€¢ Supports both normal and filled ASCII modes â€¢ Extract and play audio using pygame
ðŸ“– Summary: ASCII Flix is a Python-based terminal video player that converts video frames into ASCII art. It allows users to watch videos in a unique, minimalistic way directly within their terminal, supporting both normal and filled ASCII modes and extracting audio using pygame.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ flip-on-fail | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Adding humor and expressiveness to error messages during development and debugging.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Adds a default table flip ASCII art prefix to error messages. â€¢ Allows customization of the error message prefix. â€¢ Provides methods to enable and disable the error flipping functionality. â€¢ Works with both standard `Error` objects and `console.error` calls.
ðŸ“– Summary: Flip On Fail is a JavaScript package that enhances error messages by adding fun, expressive prefixes, such as the table flip ASCII art. It can be installed via npm or yarn and used in both browser and Node.js environments to make debugging more entertaining.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ krep | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Rapid, large-scale pattern matching in files and directories.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple search algorithms (Boyer-Moore-Horspool, KMP, Aho-Corasick) â€¢ SIMD acceleration (SSE4.2, AVX2, NEON) â€¢ Memory-mapped I/O â€¢ Multi-threaded search â€¢ Regex support (POSIX Extended Regular Expression)
ðŸ“– Summary: Krep is a high-performance string search utility written in C, designed for speed and efficiency when processing large files and directories. It offers multiple search algorithms, SIMD acceleration, memory-mapped I/O, and multi-threading to maximize throughput.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
